Eric Schmidt summed up seismic shift at Google's helm in a Twitter post last week that said, Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! Eric Schmidt has led Google since 2001, three years before the company went public in August 2004. Since then, Google's shares have grown more than sixfold, at one point surpassing$ 700. Google

At this stage, the number of opportunities just vastly exceed the number of people we have at the company, said Alan Eustace , Google's senior vice Barack Obama of engineering and research. Even if it surpasses 31,000 employees this year, Google will still have far fewer people than Microsoft Corp., probably its fiercest rival.
